you are invited to open a
charge account for one year with
The Citizens Bank of Jacksonville, and
accumulate a definite sum by the first
of December, 1932.

In our Christmas Savings Club Depart
ment we have found so many of our
regular savers, from year to year prefer
to open a Christmas Savings Account
and have us make the deposits for them
each week, by charging their checking
accounts. In this way they are relieved
of the trouble of coming to the bank
every Monday. They simply maintain
their checking accounts and we transfer
enough to the Christmas Savings Ac
count to meet the weekly payments, and
when they receive their bank statements
and cancelled checks at the end of each
month, the charge tickets show the
amounts that have been deducted and
deposited to their credit in the Christ
mas Savings Account.

This method is exceedingly simple and
Satisfactory.

For the year 1931, we had almost one
hundred charge accounts in our Christ
mas Savings Club Department. The
$5.00 per week plan seemed the most
popular. By this method a large num
ber of our depositors saved $5.00 each

body.p:
week for fifty weeks, giving them
$250.00 plus interest at the end of the
year. Though a great many were also
saving in larger as well as smaller
amounts.

This money is returned to the depositor
on the 1stfirst day of December of each year,
and is used to meet Christmas expenses,
pay Taxes, Insurance premiums, Sum
mer trips and in a few instances to make
payments on mortgages.

It is an ideal way to accumulate funds
during the year. The temptation is
always strong to spend from your earn
ings deposited in the checking account
but by having us transfer small amounts
to the Christmas Club Account, you are
enabled to lay aside a certain amount
each week with the assurance of having
a fixed sum to your credit by the first
of December. This is also an excellent
way to make every one live within one's
budget.

Charge accounts can be opened from 25
cents per week to $20.00 per week, and
we extend to each of our depositors an
invitation to avail themselves of this
opportunity to save a fixed amount by
next December 1stfirst.

Accounts may be opened at Window
22, Miss Y.E. Sears in charge.
